# ssl-proxy

This project was designed to be a [reverse proxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reverse_proxy#:~:text=In%20computer%20networks%2C%20a%20reverse,from%20the%20proxy%20server%20itself.) between the internet and your own private development server. It should provide an SSL certificate to any HTTPS requests to it, and proxy the HTTP request to the specified localhost port

<img src="data:image/png;base64,">

The proxy also has support for server certificates for multiple domain names. (e.g. domain1.com, domain2.com, domain3.com, etc...)

## Pre-requisites

To run this project, you must have:
- **Node.js** installed (version 12 or higher)
- **Npm** instaled (version 6 or higher)
- **OpenSSL** installed

## How to run

First, clone this project and run the following commands at it's root folder:

> \> npm install

> \> npm run build-start

The project should print the following message:

```
Starting proxy...

HTTPS Listening on port 443, and redirecting to port 3000

HTTP Listening on port 80, and redirecting to port 3000
```

## Possible customizations

You can change some behaviors through some environment variables. The possibilites are:

- **SSLPROXY_HTTPS_LISTEN_PORT**: Port the proxy will listen for HTTPS connections. Defaults to 443.
- **SSLPROXY_HTTP_LISTEN_PORT**: Port the proxy will listen for HTTP connections. Defaults to 80.
- **SSLPROXY_TARGET_PORT**: Port the proxy server will forward to. Defaults to 3000.

## PM2 Integration

This project has a `ecosystem.config.js` file for easier integration with [pm2](https://pm2.keymetrics.io/). It is completely optional, but nice to have.
